channel.description: Recent content in Pwn on Waheyyyyyyy

item.title: Umdctf2025 One-Write, a beautiful heap challenge
item.description:
Introduction:

WASSUP HOMIES, Mah name Tony! Welcome back to another text-based youtube video. One-Write is a challenge given to me by one of my dear senseis ndgsghdj who helped guide me along this entire challenge. This is the hardest heap challenge I’ve ever done and I want to go through the things I learnt in detail.

Table of Contents:

  1. Protections
  2. Binary Analysis
  3. Exploit

Protections:

Protections always help narrow down the options, so running checksec we see,

item.title: AYCEP2025 verysecretstorage Modprobe Path overwrite
item.description:
Introduction:

WHATS’S UP GUYS! Welcome back to another text based youtube video. Today we will be reading a writeup about verysecretstorage, a challenge made by Kaligula for AYCEP2024 (yes I am a year late and missed out greatly). This was my first kernel heap challenge as well as my first real kernel challenge and it was pretty fun.

Table of Contents:

  1. Protections
  2. Binary analysis
  3. Exploit

Protections:

Since this is my first kpwn challenge I will be going through the common protections as well as the ones that people do not talk about often in beginner writeups (in my exp pls no sue me).

item.title: NYP Infosec June CTF 2025 Liardancer Writeup
item.description:
TLDR;

Liardancer is a heap pwn challenge from the June NYP Infosec 2025 CTF written by cf (check her writeup out). It is a simple tcache poisoning into a Global Offset Table(GOT) overwrite, however with the security features of pointer mangling and the enforcement of 16 byte alignment for pointers returned by malloc().

Table of contents:

  1. Prerequisites.
  2. Binary and Source code Review.
  3. Exploit.

Prerequisites

To do this exploit, we need to have a basic understanding of malloc(), free(), tcache , the GOT and the heap.
